title: Real-Time YOLO11 Ops-Safety Challenge
business_context: In industrial environments like manufacturing floors and warehouses, operational safety is paramount. While YOLO11 Large provides high precision for PPE compliance and monitoring 'No-Go' zones, deploying high-end GPUs across massive facilities is cost-prohibitive. To scale, these models must run on standard industrial PCs or edge gateways relying solely on 8-core CPUs.
problem_statement: The 'High-Accuracy, High-Latency' trap prevents YOLO11 Large deployment in CPU-only environments. For a safety system to be actionable, it must process video at a minimum of 10 FPS; current CPU inference often falls well below this, leading to dangerous detection lags.
challenge: Optimize the YOLO11 Large inference pipeline to achieve > 10 FPS on a maximum of 8 CPU cores without significant degradation in detection accuracy.

model_optimization.export_and_quantization: Convert PyTorch model to optimized format with quantization. mAP@0.5 degradation must be ≤ 2% of FP32 baseline.
model_optimization.runtime: Leverage CPU-specific acceleration libraries for modern 8-core industrial processors.
model_optimization.processing_strategy: Implement sub-frame tiling or adaptive batching. End-to-end processing (pre-process to post-process) for a 1080p frame must be ≤ 100ms.

pipeline_efficiency.architecture: Use a multi-threaded producer-consumer architecture to decouple frame decoding from inference. Decoding must not block the inference thread.
pipeline_efficiency.sampling: Implement intelligent frame-skip or keyframe-priority strategies with lightweight object tracking interpolation to sustain ≥ 10 FPS.

resource_management.concurrency: Support at least 4 simultaneous camera feeds on an 8-core CPU.
resource_management.adaptive_control: Dynamically adjust input resolution (1080p to 720p to 480p) based on CPU load to maintain the 10 FPS floor.
resource_management.memory_constraint: Total RAM consumption (model + buffers + runtime) must not exceed 4 GB.

safety_reliability.consistency: Zero dropped detections for objects present in ≥ 3 consecutive frames.
safety_reliability.latency_sla: Total pipeline latency from hazard appearance to alert signal must be ≤ 300ms.
